page.title: 04The New Harvington By_Pass.
page.content: The By_Pass was made and finished in nineteen seventy five to stop the heavy vehicles coming through the village.It took nearly twelve months to make and the people making it had to buy about one hundred and fifty acres of land. The by_pass is on the Stratford to Evesham road. It goes through the middle of the old railway line which no longer exists. The by_pass is also joined to Crest Hill which connects it to the village. It caused a lot of fuss around the village because of the land being bought by compulsory purchase from the local people.It is now quieter in the village except when there is an accident and the road is closed.We have done a traffic count, and in twenty minutes 40 lorries,100 cars,12 vans,2 buses and 3 motor bikes went past.We obviously needed it.
